title: fix: subcircuit having multiple traces between same pins
description: Fixes the issue where multiple traces could be created between the same pins in a subcircuit, ensuring that only necessary traces are routed.
body: `getSimpleRouteJsonFromCircuitJson` collects all the `source_trace` elements whose `subcircuit_id` is this group OR any descendant sub-circuit (even when that subcircuit is having traces which is already routed). And then that simpleRouteJson is passed to the autorouter where the already resolved `source_trace` gets dragged.

title: feat: Restrict AI review generation to package owners
description: This PR restricts the ability to generate AI reviews to only the package owner, enhancing security by preventing unauthorized users from accessing this functionality.
body:
This pull request introduces a security enhancement that limits the ability to generate or re-generate AI reviews to only the package owner. Previously, any authenticated user had access to this functionality.

---

###  Changes Implemented

#### `src/components/ViewPackagePage/components/important-files-view.tsx`

* Added a `packageAuthorId` prop to the component.
* Replaced the `useUser` hook with `useGlobalStore` to retrieve the currently logged-in user's session info.
* Conditionally render the **"Request AI Review"** and **"Re-request AI Review"** buttons only when the logged-in user's `github_username` matches the `packageAuthorId`.

#### `src/components/ViewPackagePage/components/repo-page-content.tsx`

* Passed the `packageAuthorOwner` (sourced from `packageInfo.owner_github_username`) as a prop to the `ImportantFilesView` component.

title: Fix caching issue by rounding the deltas with a higher precision
description: Fixes caching issue in the unravelMultiSectionSolver by rounding delta values to a higher precision, preventing errors from accumulated rounding.
body:
### Why are we changing this?
We've observed cases where the `unravelMultiSectionSolver` was not completely caches during the second time it was solved. The working theory was that there were some rounding issues causing this.

### What has changed?
Delta values used in in the cached values of the `unravelMultiSectionSolver` are now rounded to a higher precision than the coordinates. This prevents issues from accumulated errors due to rounding.

### Visualisation
https://streamable.com/yr0hm1
